meanings.definition: In a tyrannical manner; oppressively or unjustly.
meanings.sent1: The king ruled tyrannically, making unfair laws and punishing innocent people.
meanings.sent2: The dictator governed the country tyrannically, suppressing any form of dissent.
meanings.sent3: The teacher tyrannically declared that no recess would be allowed for the rest of the year.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged tyrannically, destroying everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the story behaved tyrannically, causing chaos and fear among the villagers.
